page.title: 01RIPLEY (East) and CODNOR
page.content: This area covers the eastern half of Ripley including Peasehill and Waingroves, and the village of Codnor including Cross Hill.Both places were mentioned in the original Domesday book.Ripley's market and fair have medieval origins, and the DeGrey family built a castle at Codnor. Its ruins still stand today. Both places developed in the 19th century resulting from coal mining in the area. The pits have all closed now, but parts of the area are still being mined by open cast.New industry has been attracted into the area by the creation of industrial estates. Ripley has a Town Council and Codnor a Parish Council. Both come under the Amber Valley District Council and Derbyshire County Council which are Labour controlled. The MP for Amber Valley is Conservative. {MB
